div.p: ONLINE USER 1: So environment isn't as important as our biology? I gotta admit... I didn't expect that.
ONLINE USER 2: Yeah I always thought people learned this stuff from their parents, like, "Hey, I learned it from you, Dad."
ONLINE USER 3: So I guess I've got nothing to worry about. My parents haven't had a drink since their wedding.
ONLINE USER 4: So, it doesn't mean you're safe. There's no get-out-of-jail-free card or anything. I mean, just because my dad was an alcoholic, it's no guarantee that I'm going to become one.

DUSTIN: ...Actually, that didn't suprise... I've looked into that before cause I was adopted and both of my biological parents actually had alcoholism and my adoptive parents did not but I developed alcoholism at a young age.
JEREMY: It... I don't know like some of it just really made me think today and yesterday... I don't know it's just a little bothersome to myself because my whole family, well not my whole...

JEREMY: My father to both of my grandfathers are definite alcoholics. And just to see that I run a real real real high risk, even with my mom warning me, of course I should listen my mom, who really ever does till it's too late.
